ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Matlab Toolbox : problem with ctmethods
ygData.msgSnippet: Following your advice I was able to run the Matlab Cantera demos. Although the Matlab I m using (Academic Version 7.0.0.19920) recognizes the dll extension

Following your advice I was able to run the Matlab Cantera demos.  
Althoug=
h the Matlab I'm using (Academic Version 7.0.0.19920) recognizes the "dll" =
extension and not the "mexw32" extension y just had to include the director=
y "cantera\Cantera\matlab\cantera" located in the Cantera source directory =
as a Matlab path (using the set path option).  Cantera correctly generated =
a ctmethods.dll file and a ctmethods.mexw32 dummy file, but they were in th=
e source directory, not in the application directory (where Cantera was ins=
talled).
Alejandro

----- Mensaje original -----
De: David Goodwin <dgoodwi=
n@...>

Asunto: Re: [=
cantera] Matlab Toolbox : problem with ctmethods

blem with file extensions.  You may need to 
> 
> change the extension on c=
tmethods from "mexw32" to "dll", which  
> earlier versions of MATLAB used =
for MEX files under Windows.
> 
>
